medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports LLQ pain since the evening prior to presentation, with episodes of periumbilical and LLQ pain occurring over the past year. The current presentation is noted to be the worst, described as dull, constant, and non-radiating, preventing sleep. The pain was unrelieved by alkaselter, which had been effective in the past. The patient also experienced nausea with dry heaves and had a bowel movement the previous night consisting of narrow caliber formed stool. No recent unintentional weight loss is reported.
